abstract: The merger of Omnicom and Publicis signals that advertising is now firmly in the business of collecting and selling the personal information of millions of consumers.
snippet: The merger of Omnicom and Publicis signals that advertising is now firmly in the business of collecting and selling the personal information of millions of consumers.
lead_paragraph: For years, the advertising business has been driven by the Madison Avenue mythology of small independent shops coming up with the snappy catchphrase or memorable TV commercial that becomes part of everyday culture.

headline.main: Two Ad Giants Chasing Google in Merger Deal
headline.print_headline: Two Ad Giants Chasing Google In Merger Deal

abstract: The merger of Omnicom and Publicis signals that advertising is in the business of personal information. | A seemingly small change to the voting rules for the proposed buyout of Dell could have a big effect. | What were SAC Capital’s compliance officers doing? | A son of Warren E. Buffett discusses the pitfalls of philanthropy.
snippet: The merger of Omnicom and Publicis signals that advertising is in the business of personal information. | A seemingly small change to the voting rules for the proposed buyout of Dell could have a big effect. | What were SAC Capital’s compliance of...
lead_paragraph: IN MERGER, AD GIANTS CHASE GOOGLE  |  The announcement on Sunday that Omnicom and Publicis would merge to create the largest advertising company in the world signals that advertising is now in the business of Big Data: collecting and selling the personal information of millions of consumers, Tanzina Vega writes in The New York Times.

headline.main: Advertising in the Business of Big Data

abstract: If you do not have access to your cellphone for Gmail’s verification process, there is an option to print out a set of codes.
snippet: If you do not have access to your cellphone for Gmail’s verification process, there is an option to print out a set of codes.
lead_paragraph: Q. I have the Gmail two-step verification turned on for my account, but I am preparing to travel overseas and will not be able to use my cellphone to get verification codes. Should I just turn off the two-step verification for my trip?
